question_sentence: Tiger Woods was inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame on Wednesday. How many major championships has he won?
The wreck of explorer Ernest Shackleton’s ship Endurance was found. What year did the ship sink?

The record for the national average cost for a regular gallon of gas was broken this week. What was the previous high mark, set in 2008?
Which country music star won entertainer of the year at this year’s ACM Awards?
The first person to receive a gene-edited heart from an animal has died. What kind of animal was the organ from?
Nine-time Pro Bowl QB Russell Wilson was traded from the Seattle Seahawks to which team?

To protest Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, Stoli Vodka changed its name from what?
True or false: The ‘Don’t Say Gay’ bill which prohibits “classroom discussion about sexual orientation or gender identity was passed in Florida.
The wreck of Antarctic explorer Ernest Shackleton’s ship the Endurance was discovered well preserved in which sea over a century after it was abandoned?
evidence: The explorer set out to cross Antarctica via the South Pole on the 1914 Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition. But he was forced to abandon the Endurance after it was crushed between ice floes in January 1915.

question_sentence: Which Latin alphabet letter has become a symbol of support for Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine?
evidence: The Z symbol, which does not exist in the Cyrillic Russian alphabet, was first spotted on military vehicles. Some interpret the letter as short for the Russian word for ‘victory’, while others say it represents the language’s word for ‘west

question_sentence: Nicola Sturgeon offered a formal apology to people accused of what crime between the 16th and 18th centuries?
evidence: It is thought that some 4,000 Scots, mostly women, were executed after being accused of breaking the Witchcraft Act between 1563 and 1736

question_sentence: Labour confirmed that it will not be using which controversial process for selecting candidates for the next general election?
evidence: The party was advised that all-women shortlists would be ‘unlawful’ because the majority (52%) of its MPs are female

question_sentence: What was Olena Zelenska’s job before she became Ukraine’s first lady?
evidence: Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s wife worked on scripts at her husband's television production company Kvartal 95.

question_sentence: How many McDonald’s restaurants operated in Russia before the chain pulled out this week following the invasion of Ukraine?
evidence: The first of the fast food chain’s 850 stories opened in 1990 on Moscow’s Pushkin Square.

question_sentence: A US study has found that exposure to which substance may have lowered the IQ of about half the country’s population?
evidence: For people born in the 1960s and the 1970s, when leaded gas use was increasing, the IQ loss was found to be up to seven points

question_sentence: Australian cricketer Shane Warne, who died this week, was often referred to as a ‘larrikin’ by his countrymen. What does the colloquial term mean?
evidence: Widely considered one of the best bowlers in cricketing history, he took 708 Test wickets throughout his 14-year career, more than any other bowler in history

question_sentence: What was the name of the political theorist and women’s rights activist who organised the first International Women’s Day?
evidence: The activist came up with the idea of an international day for women at the International Conference of Working Women in Copenhagen in 1910, where it was unanimously agreed upon

question_sentence: When did Roman Abramovich buy Chelsea FC?
evidence: The Russian oligarch has been sanctioned by the government as part of its response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, which means he is currently unable to sell the club as he had planned

question_sentence: American Express, Visa and Mastercard recently suspended their operations in which country?
evidence: American Express, Visa and Mastercard all announced they are ending their operations in Russia as its invasion of Ukraine escalates.

question_sentence: The National Weather Service recently declared a series of severe weather events in Iowa. What destroyed more than 50 homes and claimed seven lives?
evidence: A series of deadly tornadoes killed seven people, including two children, after they ripped through multiple counties near Des Moines, Iowa. The National Weather Service declared it a severe event, with wind speeds reaching at least 136 miles per hour.

question_sentence: “The Batman” had the best opening of 2022 so far. How much did the movie bring in at the North American box office during its premiere weekend?
evidence: “The Batman” brought in about $128 million, flying by industry expectations that had the movie making closer to $100 million.

question_sentence: The so-called “Don’t Say Gay” bill was passed this week, banning teachers in what state from discussing sexual orientation and gender identity in classrooms?
evidence: Lawmakers in Florida approved the controversial bill that bans certain instruction about sexual orientation and gender identity in the classroom. Conservatives have argued that the bill is needed in order to give parents greater oversight over what students learn and discuss at school, stressing that LGBTQ-related topics should be left for families to discuss at home. Opponents argue the measure would negatively impact an already marginalized community.

question_sentence: What global holiday was celebrated this week?
evidence: International Women’s Day was celebrated on March 8! To mark the holiday, we asked women around the world what lessons they’ve learned during the pandemic that could help other women in the year ahead. Here are their responses.

question_sentence: The governor of New Mexico announced a measure that allocates $75 million to support what initiative?
evidence: New Mexico Gov. Michelle Lujan Grisham signed a bill that will make state colleges tuition-free.

question_sentence: Which sports star is currently detained in Russia?
evidence: Basketball star Brittney Griner was arrested in Russia on allegations of drug smuggling for trying to bring cannabis oil through a Russian airport. Family, friends and supporters of Griner remain in the dark about her well-being amid the backdrop of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

question_sentence: The House of Representatives passed a massive government funding bill this week that includes more than $13 billion in aid for what country?
evidence: The huge spending bill includes $13.6 billion in fresh aid to Ukraine as the country fights back against Russia’s invasion.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden signed an executive order Wednesday calling on the US government to study the risks of what?
evidence: Joe Biden ordered a study of cryptocurrencies, and wants specifically to explore the possibility of a government-backed digital currency that would be operated by the US central bank.

question_sentence: What well-known company recently announced a 20-for-1 stock split?
evidence: Shares of Amazon are about to get much, much cheaper. If shareholders approve the move, the company’s 20-for-1 stock split in June will be its first since 1999.
